 From : L. David Baron < dbaron@dbaron.org >
 Date : Mon, 12 May 2008 17:04:09 -0700 
 To : Patrick Garies < pgaries@fastmail.us >
 Cc :  www-style@w3.org 
 Message-ID : <20080513000409.GA4378@pickering.dbaron.org>
On Tuesday 2007-06-26 21:59 -0500, Patrick Garies wrote [in
 http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Public/www-style/2007Jun/0187.html  ]:
> Do the "SVG color keywords" [1] apply outside of SVG? For example,  
> should they apply in HTML? I would say “yes” since major Web browsers  
> currently support them in such contexts, but the example profile for  
> HTML 4 [2] excludes SVG color keywords and Section 4.3 [3] has “SVG” in  
> the name.
This has been recorded as
 http://csswg.inkedblade.net/spec/css3-color#issue-19  and has been
addressed in the editor's draft at
 http://dev.w3.org/csswg/css3-color/#svg-color  by adding the
sentence:
  # This specification extends their definition beyond SVG.
-David
> [1]  http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#svg-color 
> [2]  http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#profiles 
> [3]  http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-color/#svg-color 
-- 
L. David Baron                                  http://dbaron.org/ 
Mozilla Corporation                        http://www.mozilla.com/
